page.title: 05THE AMBERLEY CHURCH & CASTLE
page.content: THE PARISH CHURCH OF ST. MICHAEL, AMBERLEY. The building is 800 years old. Its chancel is as long as its nave. It was once used by Bishops of Chichester, who lived in the adjoining Castle, particularly to ordain priests. There is a south aisle, a tower of 5 bells rung anticlockwise and a porch. Points of interest are a Norman chancel arch and medieval wall paintings. There is a priest-in-charge who also looks after four other churches. 60-70 people worship on Sundays at two services at 8.00 and 10.30 am. The two churchwardens and a P.C.C. work with the vicar in running the church. The Castle, now privately owned, is a fortified manor house built in the 14th century with walls added in later centuries. It now has a portcullis operated by an electric switch !
